summary:
## Integers: A Summary

Integers are numbers we use in everyday life: positive numbers (1, 2, 3...), negative numbers (-1, -2, -3...), and zero (0). They can be arranged on a number line.

Think of them as all the counting numbers, their opposites, and zero. Integers don't have any fractional parts. They are a special subset of rational numbers and form their own infinite set.
title: Integer
